titles.title: Mewkledreamy
ミュークルドリーミー
夢夢貓 Mewkledreamy

recommendations.recommendation:
The series is a mix of traditional magical girl and modern SoL-comedy anime. It`s (very) high paced, the characters are highly expressive & reactive, could be as absurd as the modern SoL-comedy such as Machikado Mazoku, Tonari no Kyuuketsuki-san, Kiniro Mosaic, etc. Definitely a good watch if you like that high density format, even if you`re not fan of the magical girl.
Alas, the main plotline is so bland (the dream, magical girl, or anything other than the SoL aspects). It`s a shame coz they`re actually focusing a big part on the plot, at least comparably to other similar series.
Visual wise, it`s also up to standard to all of those: consistent stills + face, and fluid animations.

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr1288 [Sanrio]`s Mewkledreamy character. Yume is a cheerful first-year junior high school student who by chance picked up Mew, a speaking kitten plush who fell from the sky. By becoming Dream Partners, Mew possesses the power of "Dream Synchro" and is able to enter one`s dream along with Yume. That night, the queen of Miracle Dreamy Kingdom appeared in Yume`s dream, telling her that if she and Mew collect a lot of Dreamy Stones, she can grant her one wish. Since then, Yume starts to collect Dreamy Stones with Mew, while enjoying her school life. Source: Wikipedia

externalentity.identifier: ミュークルドリーミー

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: henshin
tag.description: Japanese for "transformation" (metamorphosis or disguise). A "henshin anime" is any anime, where the characters or their costumes transform, such as Sailor Moon. The henshin switches on the character`s special powers, and is frequently accompanied by a costume change. Often the change of clothing is the only outward indicator that the character has changed and yet nobody seems to notice the hero`s true self. Most henshin heroes have a special item which they use to change into their heroic form. These items are usually activated by a command phrase (which is often in Engrish, for some reason), triggering a transformation sequence.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: funny expressions
tag.description: The facial expressions of the characters may change so quickly or unexpectedly distort that hilarity will ensue.

tag.name: merchandising show
tag.description: The bane of the parent`s wallet; this show usually has only a single reason for existence: to advertise the toy line it is based upon to the intended target audience. The variety of toys can range from accessories for girls and boys, to cards and figures or models. Most often the ability of the toys will be exaggerated or invokes magic to work in the anime. The toys`s names will also be continuously repeated in the anime, often accompanied by flashy effects and loud shouting. Combined with an intricate story that typically involves an adventure or a tournament of sorts, it makes for an effective commercial.

tag.name: dialogue driven
tag.description: A dialogue driven show has its story advanced by dialogue, with action being of much lower priority, and relies heavily on conversations between characters.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: self-parody
tag.description: The anime is a parody of itself. I.e. the authors make fun of the genre they are portraying, and take the actions of their characters and story lightly.

tag.name: dreams and reality
tag.description: This genre of anime is typically set in both the world as we know it (reality) and a world of dreams, mythology or imagination. Sometimes this dreamworld is actually real, sometimes it is not. Other times what we think is the real world is the dreamworld, and vice versa. They are not always easy to distinguish from each other, neither by the characters nor the viewer. Whatever is real, and whatever is reality, both worlds are integral in shaping both the plot of this anime and the development of the characters.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Joou-sama
character.description: Queen of the Miracle Dreamy Kingdom. She appeared in her dream and told her that collecting dreamy stones with her would fulfill her dream.

character.name: Takatsu Hitoe
character.description: She is a member of the art club.

character.name: Kusama Futami
character.description: She is a member of the art club.

character.name: Kuro-chan
character.description: appearance within Hana`s dream and him

character.name: Reporter
character.description: broadcasting from Waikiki, where he won the costume contest, Suzuki

episode.title: はじまりのストーリー
Episode 1
Hajimari no Story
episode.summary: After falling from the sky, Mew helps Yume to enter her overworked mother’s dream following a stressful day at the office with explosive consequences. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: ユメシンクロで仮入部
Episode 2
Yume Synchro de Kari Nyuubu
episode.summary: Yume learns that she can have one wish granted if she agrees to collect Dreamy Stones at the request of the queen of the Miracle Dream Kingdom. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: 先輩の夢に入っちゃお
Episode 3
Senpai no Yume ni Haicchao
episode.summary: With Mew’s help, Yume tries using a magical power to enter the dream of Sugiyama, a popular older boy at school, but finds herself in the wrong dream. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: もう一人のドリーミーメイト?
Episode 4
Mou Hitori no Dreamy Mate?
episode.summary: When Yume is invited to her classmate Maira’s home after visiting her at a photo shoot, she discovers a stuffed animal who reminds her of Mew. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: ことことコトコト
Episode 5
Kotokoto Kotokoto
episode.summary: When a robot returns her lost bag with Mew still inside, Yume is led to third-year student Kotoko, who is part of the school`s computer club. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: はじめての中間テスト
Episode 6
Haijimete no Nakama Test
episode.summary: After Kotoko finds a rain-drenched stuffed animal on her roof, Yume and Maira decide to ask her for help with studying for an upcoming exam. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: フレッ! フレッ! おさななじみ
Episode 7
Fure! Fure! Osananajimi
episode.summary: Invited by her crush Sugiyama, Yume attends a practice match for the tennis club where her childhood friend Asahi fills in for an injured player. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: 林間学校で大ゲンカ!?
Episode 8
Rinkangakkou de Oogenka!?
episode.summary: As Yume and her friends depart for a three-day nature camp, they find themselves playing matchmaker when Yume`s classmate Wakaba develops a crush. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: きゅうちゃんのゆううつ
Episode 9
Kyuu-chan no Yuuutsu
episode.summary: When Yume’s pet dog Kyu seems down during a picnic, she enters his dream to find the cause. But once inside, Kyu looks nothing like what she expected. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: 雨ふりねぶそくゆめちゃん
Episode 10
Amefuri Nebusoku Yume-chan
episode.summary: A forlorn Yume misses seeing Sugiyama at practice now that it rains every day, but Kaede knows a love spell that can turn her luck around. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: ななちゃんとあそぼ
Episode 11
Nana-chan to Asobo
episode.summary: Yume’s younger cousin Nana misses her mom too much to enjoy her playdate at Yume’s house, so Yume and her friends must keep a close eye on her. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: オレっちが先に見つけるにゅい
Episode 12
Orecchi ga Saki ni Mitsukeru nyui
episode.summary: Hearing from the queen that Mew has another dream partner, Yume and her friends rush off to find her. Yuni is summoned by the Queen of Nightmares. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: 転校生ときわちゃん
Episode 13
Tengakusei Tokiwa-chan
episode.summary: A girl named Tokiwa Anzai transfers to Yume`s school, where she soon finds herself the target of the mischievous Yuni and his dream-invading magic. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: ときわちゃん大争奪
Episode 14
Tokiwa-chan Dai Soudatsu
episode.summary: Tokiwa shows off her athletic skills in a school dodgeball contest. But her gift becomes a curse when she attracts more attention than she can handle. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: ドキドキ花火大会
Episode 15
Dokidoki Hanabi Taikai
episode.summary: Yume and her friends meet up to rent dresses for a fireworks festival. When news of the event reaches Yuni, he sees an opportunity to cause mayhem. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: 私はやっぱりチアっちゃお!
Episode 16
Watashi wa Yappari Cheercchao!
episode.summary: Yume becomes unable to watch Sugiyama play tennis after he quits the club. Realizing how down she feels, her friends endeavor to cheer her up. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: 恐怖のプチトマトマン
Episode 17
Kyoufu no Puchi Tomato Man
episode.summary: Yume has a nightmare about her most hated food: cherry tomatoes. Mew tries helping her learn to like them but the tomato-filled dreams only get worse. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: 岬に行ってはいけないよ
Episode 18
Misaki ni Itte wa Ikenai yo
episode.summary: Yume celebrates her birthday while at camp. Although she and her friends can’t enjoy cake or a party, her teachers have a tasty alternative lined up. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: お誕生日ゆめちゃん合宿中
Episode 19
Otanjoubi Yume-chan Gasshuku Chuu
episode.summary: The school cheerleading and tennis clubs go on a camp together. Soon after arriving, an old woman warns them to keep away from a certain coastal cape. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: ボンジュール! れいくん
Episode 20
Bonjour! Rei-kun
episode.summary: Yume notices that Asahi has been acting strangely since returning from camp. Asahi is taken aback when his newly acquired toy starts talking to him. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: 寛太と健太のユメシンクロ
Episode 21
Kanta to Kenta no Yume Synchro
episode.summary: After Tokiwa’s twin brothers Kanta and Kenta arrive home and meet her friends, Tokiwa explains that Kanta hasn`t been his cheerful self lately. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: スギヤマ☆パラダイス
Episode 22
Sugiyama Paradise
episode.summary: Mysterious events begin occurring at Yume`s school, from scattered shoes and wet hallways to yokai sightings and a strange voice heard in class. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: はなちゃんの夢
Episode 23
Hana-chan no Yume
episode.summary: Yume goes to buy the new issue of a comic magazine but finds it has sold out. She then sees her classmate and aspiring comic artist Hana with a copy. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: パワーアップな文化祭
Episode 24
Power Up na Bunkasai
episode.summary: With the school culture festival coming up, Yume’s class decides to prepare a whack-a-mole game. A reluctant Asahi is volunteered to play the mole. Source: Netflix Japan (translated)

episode.title: ドリーミーメイトだよ全員集合!
Episode 25
Doremi Maid Da yo Zen`in Shuugou!
おさななじみにはわかるの?
Episode 26
Osananajimi ni wa Wakaru no?
ようこそ! お空の上のお城へ
Episode 27
Youkoso! Osora no Ue no Oshiro e
こわがりのカボチャさん
Episode 29
Kowagari no Kabocha-san
デートでドキドキゆめちゃん
Episode 31
Date de Dokidoki Yume-chan
誕生日はワンワンいちごー!
Episode 32
Tanjoubi wa Wanwan Ichigoo!
届くといいな ドリーミーチャーム
Episode 33
Todoku to Ii na: Dreamy Charm
まいらちゃんと牧場へ
Episode 34
Maira-chan to Bokujou e
年末年始はみんなでハッピー!
Episode 36
Nenmatsunenshi wa Minna de Happy!
